item.title: cut new york consultants to save $300 million: union
item.description: as new york governor andrew cuomo and public-employee unions negotiate over his threat to lay off 9,800 state workers, one union on thursday said that the state could save $300 million alone by using fewer private consultants.

item.title: cuban communist party congress looks to future
item.description: cuba's ruling communist party meets on saturday for a congress expected to introduce possible future leaders and endorse groundbreaking economic reforms in what is one of the world's last one-party communist states.

item.title: six western conference players to watch down the stretch

item.title: budget cuts raise doubt on course of recovery
item.description: some economists predict the budget reductions could slow the nation's recovery, but others disagree.

item.title: feds arrest 12 in airport drug smuggling probe
item.description: a dozen people, including 10 current or former delta air lines baggage handlers, face drug trafficking and related charges in a probe of cocaine and marijuana smuggling, federal officials said on thursday.

item.title: u.s. unemployment filings rose last week
item.description: in a second report, american companies squeezed more work out of their staffs in the first three months, but the gain in productivity was much slower than the previous three months.

item.title: security experts: playstation network breach one of largest ever
item.description: the external hack of sony's playstation network represents one of the largest data breaches ever, security experts suggest.

item.title: iran wants shourd to return from u.s. for trial
item.description: iran wants sarah shourd, one of three americans arrested in 2009 on spying charges, to return from the united states to stand trial in may, her lawyer was quoted as saying on tuesday.

item.description: chris capuano kept the mets in the game tuesday as his new team returned to his former professional home.

item.description: most children's movies have an accompanying video game. "hop" is the newest, offered on the nintendo ds.

item.title: idaho governor signs abortion ban after 20 weeks
item.description: idaho's governor said on thursday he signed into law a measure banning abortions after 20 weeks of pregnancy, making idaho the third state to enact such a late term abortion prohibition.

item.title: twin sisters die in n.c. storm after tree falls on home
item.description: eighteen-year-old twin sisters were killed on wednesday when a tree fell on their home during thunderstorms that swept through the town of ellenboro, north carolina, police said.

item.description: the raw figures on how many were accepted (and rejected) this year by virginia tech, wisconsin, purdue, macalester and dozens of other colleges and universities.

item.title: green column: the peril of plastic
item.description: half of the plastic produced is used only once before being discarded. most of that ends up in landfills. some is recycled. but a significant amount ends up in the sea.

item.title: uk to hold "thousands" of wedding street parties
